items.title: Ashish Kacholia, Anil Goel, Mukul Agrawal & Ashish Dhawan lose big as portfolios crash up to 29%
items.description: Indian investor portfolios experienced significant declines in the July-September quarter. Many top investors saw double-digit drops as markets turned volatile. Ashish Dhawan's portfolio fell the most, down 29%. However, some investors like Nemish Shah and Vijay Kedia saw their portfolios grow. Market indices also reflected this weakness during the period.

items.title: After over 300x subscription, Gallard Steel to finalise allotment today. Check status, GMP and other details
items.description: Gallard Steel’s IPO allotment concludes today after extraordinary demand, with subscription touching record levels across categories. Strong GMP indicates optimism for listing gains, though allotment is expected to be extremely tight. The company’s rapid financial growth and specialised engineering capabilities add to investor interest ahead of its BSE SME debut.

items.title: US holiday season set for choppiness as valuations and volatility spike
items.description: Investors are heading into the year-end with caution as uncertainty around near-term Fed rate cuts and concerns over stretched AI valuations weigh on sentiment. Despite a strong rally earlier, both the S&P 500 and Nasdaq have slipped — down 4% and 7% respectively from their late-October peaks. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Stock picks of the week: 5 stocks with consistent score improvement and possible upside potential of more than 27% in 1 year
items.description: The overall construct of the Indian stock market is bullish, though one should expect some profit-booking from time to time. Keeping this in mind, it would be good to remain bullish while being ready to digest some volatility. In such a phase, focus on the fundamentals of companies and developments in different sectors. Our selected stocks for today depict a strong upward trajectory in their overall average score which is based on five key pillars: Earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum. This implies that there has been a significant improvement in their market outlook in the given time frame.

items.title: Teamlease shares rally 11%. How it stands to benefit from India’s labour reforms
items.description: TeamLease Services shares surged 11% to Rs 1,840.65 on the BSE following the November 21 implementation of India’s new labour codes. The reforms, including the Code on Social Security, 2020, are expected to accelerate the shift from unorganised to organised employment, boosting demand for staffing firms. Compliance-driven companies like TeamLease stand to gain from higher revenue opportunities in workforce management.

items.title: Explained: What India's new labour laws mean for Eternal, Swiggy investors
items.description: India's new labor code, effective November 21, imposes a new cost burden on food delivery giants Swiggy and Eternal, potentially impacting margins by up to 70 basis points. The regulation mandates contributions to a social security fund for gig workers, leading to an estimated financial hit for both companies and potential stock volatility as investors assess the impact.

items.title: India's solar glut threatens a multibagger theme that once delivered 60,000% returns
items.description: India’s solar sector has been a stock market powerhouse, with panel makers, developers and EPC players delivering massive returns amid a clean energy push and rapid manufacturing expansion. KPI Green, Borosil Renewables, Tata Power and Adani Green have surged sharply, while standout performer Waaree Renewable Technologies delivered over 60,000% returns. Websol Energy and Solar Industries India also posted multibagger gains.

items.title: NBCC shares jump 5% after securing new orders worth over Rs 110 crore
items.description: NBCC’s shares gained after the company secured multiple new project orders across Tamil Nadu, Agra, and Jharkhand. Strong yearly gains, premium valuations, and bullish technical indicators support sentiment. Order inflows, stable momentum, and sustained sector demand continue to reinforce investor confidence in the company’s growth outlook.

items.title: Groww shares jump over 3%, extend gains for second session. What’s fuelling the rally in Billionbrains?
items.description: Groww’s parent, Billionbrains Garage Ventures, rebounded after a sharp fall, supported by strong profitability, high margins and rapid scalability. Despite steep valuations and potential regulatory risks, demand remains firm due to digital dominance and efficient operations. Investor enthusiasm follows heavy FOMO-driven post-listing gains and strong institutional interest during the IPO.

items.title: Karnataka Bank shares rally 7% as Aditya Kumar Halwasia buys Rs 71 crore worth stake
items.description: Shares of Karnataka Bank surged after a stake purchase by Aditya Kumar Halwasia, the Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) of Cupid Ltd.

items.title: Infosys, Tech Mahindra, HCL Tech, TCS shares rise up to 3%. Here’s why
items.description: Indian IT major shares, including Infosys, Tech Mahindra, HCL Tech, and TCS rallied after US Federal Reserve official John Williams indicated that interest rates could fall “in the near term.” These remarks significantly boosted expectations for a December policy easing (rate cut) by the US Fed.

items.title: RRG charts signal fresh sector leadership as infra, PSU banks and metals take charge
items.description: Indian markets concluded the week on a positive note, extending their upward trend. The Nifty experienced a narrow trading range but closed with net gains. While volatility increased, the broader trend remains bullish, supported by strong technical indicators and positive sector rotation. Investors are advised to remain selectively optimistic, with key support and resistance levels identified for the upcoming week.

items.title: Shaily Engineering shares up 3%; UBS initiates buy with 60% upside potential
items.description: UBS has initiated coverage on Shaily Engineering Plastics with a Buy rating and a target price of Rs 4,000, citing strong growth prospects driven by its patented technology, upcoming GLP-1 generic launch, and improving utilisation across consumer and industrial segments. The brokerage expects robust earnings growth and market share gains supported by high entry barriers and favourable trade conditions.

items.title: 35 stocks to buy from 11 sectors: All high conviction picks from Axis Securities put together after Q2
items.description: Axis Securities has released a sweeping list of 35 high-conviction stock ideas across 11 sectors after the second-quarter results, spanning real estate, power, IT services, cement, retail and FMCG. These picks reflect the brokerage’s view on India’s strongest structural themes — formalisation, consumption, credit growth, energy transition and manufacturing revival.The list below compiles all of Axis Securities’ preferred names, sector by sector, to help investors understand where the brokerage sees the most visibility and upside in FY26.

items.title: Doves and Hawks clash over next move after October Fed rate cut
items.description: After the Federal Reserve cut rates by 25 bps in October to support the labour market, policymakers are now sharply divided on what comes next. Some officials argue that further easing risks stoking inflation, while others believe a cooling job market justifies another cut. The debate has intensified as economic data sends mixed signals. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Bessent sees strong 2026 ahead despite $11 billion shutdown hit
items.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the 43-day government shutdown inflicted an $11 billion permanent loss on the U.S. economy. Despite this setback, he remained optimistic, predicting strong and stable growth in 2026 as interest rates ease and tax cuts begin to support demand. (Source: Reuters)

items.title: Worst of earnings cut behind: Jefferies picks 2 fastest growing sectors
items.description: Jefferies anticipates a strong earnings recovery for Indian companies. The firm expects growth to accelerate from the second half of FY26 through FY27. Cement and telecom sectors are projected to lead this rebound with significant growth rates. This positive outlook follows a challenging period marked by various economic headwinds.

items.title: Market Wrap: Sensex slips 331 points, Nifty below 25,950; IT stocks gain
items.description: Indian benchmark indices closed lower on Monday, with the Sensex falling 331 points and Nifty declining below 26,000. Despite a rally in IT stocks driven by expectations of a December Federal Reserve rate cut, broader market sentiment was negative. Nifty faced repeated rejections at the 26,200 resistance zone.

items.title: Time to have an unbiased look at them: 6 housing finance stocks with an upside potential of up to 42%
items.description: It is a sector that has borne the brunt of regulatory changes and also different scams in the past. So it is not surprising that it has been somewhat of a mixed bag where the stock market is concerned. It has seen winners like HDFC emerge. It has also thrown up spectacular losers like DHFL. Yet, the fact is that housing finance companies, or HFCs, can only grow – as demand for housing is always going to rise. What matters is which stock you own. And, more importantly, how long you hold it.

items.title: European shares recover as US rate-cut hopes lift sentiment; Ukraine talks in focus
items.description: Meanwhile, the U.S. and Ukraine are set to continue work on a plan on Monday, after agreeing to modify an earlier proposal that was widely seen as too favourable to Moscow

items.title: Stock Radar: SBI stock breaks out from bullish flag pattern to hit fresh highs in November; check target & stop loss
items.description: State Bank of India (SBI) broke out from a bullish flag pattern, hitting fresh record highs. Experts suggest short-term traders can buy the stock for a target above Rs 1,000 in the next 1-2 months, citing renewed buying interest and bullish technical indicators.

items.title: Adani Group delivers strong H1 on record capex, EBITDA hits Rs 47,375 crore
items.description: Adani Group reported a strong first half for FY26, driven by record capital expenditure and higher operating earnings. The group's total asset base reached Rs 6.77 lakh crore, with EBITDA at Rs 47,375 crore, primarily from core infrastructure businesses. Leverage remained below guided ranges, and credit quality improved significantly.

items.title: Retail and FIIs bet together: 12 stocks soar up to 840% in 8 months. Do you own any?
items.description: This fiscal year, the stock market has displayed a rare and fascinating trend: retail investors and large institutional players, especially Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs), are moving in sync, fueling significant gains across major stocks.Data from the September 2025 quarter indicates a clear rise in activity: around 166 stocks with a market capitalisation above Rs 2,500 crore saw both retail investors and FIIs increase their holdings compared to the June 2025 quarter. This aligned interest has helped power strong market momentum and reflects a renewed sense of investor confidence. (Retail investors: Resident individuals holding nominal share capital up to Rs 2 lakh)In FY26 so far, 57 companies have delivered impressive price returns of nearly 25% in a relatively short span. But the real standouts are the 12 stocks that have more than doubled investor wealth within just the first eight months of FY26, posting gains ranging from 100% to an extraordinary 840%. Yes, some investors have witnessed a surge of over 9 times in under a year. It’s worth noting, however, that a few of these high-flying stocks have relatively lower trading volumes. (Data Source: ACE Equity)
